8000.description: Incoming REST server port. The Restic rest-server default (TCP 8000) is already taken so TCP 9000 is used here.
8000.label: REST server port

/data.description: Choose a share for the Restic backup data repository. This share is mapped to /data within the container.
/data.label: Restic Data

PUID.description: Enter a valid UID to run rest-server with. It must have full permissions to all Shares mapped in the previous step.
PUID.label: UID

PGID.description: Enter a valid GID to use along with the same UID. It (or the above UID) must have full permissions to all Shares mapped in the previous step.
PGID.label: GID

rest-server.description:
Rest Server is a high performance HTTP server that implements restic's REST backend API. It provides secure and efficient way to backup data remotely, using restic backup client via the REST URL.

Based on the official docker image: https://hub.docker.com/r/restic/rest-server available for amd64 and arm64 architecture.
rest-server.more_info:
rest-server usage: https://github.com/restic/rest-server/blob/master/README.md#usage

htpass

If not running rest-server with the --no-auth option, create a .htpasswd file in the Restic /data share before starting container: htpasswd -B -c .htpasswd username

Initialise the Restic repo https://restic.readthedocs.io/en/stable/030_preparing_a_new_repo.html#rest-server

The rest-server documentation can be found here.
